page.title: 20Seaton Grange Farm
page.content: This family-run farm is 500 acres, 377 being owned and the rest rented. Most of the fields have had to be drained, with the help of government grants. Some of the original hawthorn hedges of the 19th Century enclosures remain, but many have been cleared, and a few willow have been planted for aesthetic reasons. Each field is named e.g.Red Land, House Close, Home Field, North Common. When the farm was bought by the family in the 1930s, animals were kept, but now the farm is just arable. Good prices may be obtained for cereals today, less labour is needed, and the family is not tied to the farm as it would be with animals. Crop rotation is : 1year peas/beans, 3years winter wheat, 1year winter barley. Sugar beet is sold to the British Sugar Corp. and oats are grown for muesli.
